intro: Bejaria drymifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white. Bejaria drymifolia is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
